trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merrow can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The merrow has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Galvanotaxis
entries: When the merrow takes lightning damage, it must make on a Constitution saving throw with DC of 10 or half of the damage you received (whichever is higher). On a failed save, the merrow is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merrow makes two attacks, one of which may be a bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.  Instead of dealing damage, the merrow can grapple the target (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its next turn, ending the effect on a success, or becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure. The medusa is not immune to its own gaze.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the initial saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

trait.name: Curative Blood
entries: The medusa's blood, for 24 hours after its death, can be applied to the lips of a {@condition petrified} creature to remove the {@condition petrified} condition.

trait.name: Hidden Killer
entries: The medusa can hide as a bonus action if all hostile creatures are averting their gaze. If the medusa starts its turn hidden, its attacks score a critical on a 19 or 20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The medusa makes three attacks with its shortsword.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. This attack deals an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage if made with advantage. On a critical hit, the target is disarmed, dropping one item of the medusa's choice that it is holding.

action.name: Flurry of Bites {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature within 5 feet must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, or half as much on a success. A {@condition poisoned} creature repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Compel Gaze
entries: As a reaction to a creature that is averting its eyes missing the medusa with a melee attack, the medusa may force it to meet her eyes. The creature must immediately save against her petrifying gaze.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its next turn, ending the effect on a success, or becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure. The medusa is not immune to its own gaze.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the initial saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

trait.name: Curative Blood
entries: The medusa's blood, for 24 hours after its death, can be applied to the lips of a {@condition petrified} creature to remove the {@condition petrified} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The medusa makes three attacks, only one of which can be with its snake hair.

action.name: Snake Hair
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. This attack deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage if made with advantage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Compel Gaze
entries: As a reaction to a creature that is averting its eyes missing the medusa with a melee attack, the medusa may force it to meet her eyes. The creature must immediately save against her petrifying gaze.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the manticore moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw Attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manticore makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.

action.name: Grinning Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A {@condition prone} or {@condition frightened} creature takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the spike embeds in the target's flesh. The target's speed is reduced by 5 ft. for each spike embedded in it. The spikes may be removed as an action with a successful DC15 medicine check, or by taking an additional {@damage 1d6} damage per spike removed.

action.name: Relish Terror
entries: The manticore describes in detail the terrors it intends to inflict on its enemies. Each creature that can hear it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the manticore for the next minute. A creature may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Cruel Jest
entries: As a reaction when a creature attempts to leave the manticore's reach, the manticore may force it to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and be dragged 5 feet back towards the manticore. If the creature fails this save, this ability does not use the manticore's reaction.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manticore makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws or three with its tail spikes.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the spike embeds in the target's flesh. The target's speed is reduced by 5 ft. for each spike embedded in it. The spikes may be removed as an action with a successful DC12 medicine check, or by taking an additional {@damage 1d6} damage per spike removed.

reaction.name: Cruel Jest
entries: As a reaction when a creature attempts to leave the manticore's reach, the manticore may force it to make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and be dragged 5 feet back towards the manticore. If the creature fails this save, this ability does not use the manticore's reaction.

trait.name: Gargantuan Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the malukant may spend its full movement to attempt a {@dc 19} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the malukant's legs. A creature may attempt the same check to climb from the malukant's legs to its back, or from its back to its head.

items.name: Legs
entries: While climbing on the malukant's legs, a creature has advantage on attacks against it. If the malukant moves at least 20 ft. on its turn, each creature climbing on its legs must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or fall off.

items.name: Back
entries: While climbing on the malukant's back, the malukant cannot target the creature with melee attacks.

items.name: Head
entries: While climbing on the malukant's head, the creature has advantage on melee attacks against the malukant and the malukant cannot target the creature with melee attacks.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: The malukant may move through the space of a Huge or smaller creature without penalty. When the elephant enters a creature's space, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Howdah
entries: The malukant carries a mobile fortress on its back. Up to eight Medium or smaller creatures can ride the malukant. Creatures riding the malukant have three-quarters cover against attacks made from the ground.

trait.name: Spear Maddened
entries: Weapon attacks against the malukant with the Reach property are made at advantage. Whenever the malukant takes damage from a spear, glaive, pike, or similar long, bladed weapon, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the malukant attacks the nearest creature it can see on its following turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malukant makes two attacks; one with its bladed tusks and one with its stomp.

action.name: Bladed Tusks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 6d8 + 7}) slashing damage and the target is pushed 15 ft. away and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. This attack deals an additional 16 ({@damage 3d10}) damage to a {@condition prone} creature.

action.name: Tusk Sweep {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 20 ft. cone must succeed on a a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 34 ({@damage 6d8 + 7}) slashing damage, be pushed 15 ft. away and knocked {@condition prone}, or take half as much damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a success. A creature that succeeds by 5 or more takes no damage and can climb onto the malukant's head as a reaction.

reaction.name: Thrash
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 136 HP, the malukant thrashes. Each creature riding or climbing on it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space adjacent to the malukant.

trait.name: Stone Glide
entries: The maedar can burrow through magical or nonmagical stone. While doing so, the maedar doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Curative Touch
entries: A creature touched or attacked by the maedar is cured of petrification, unless it is using its stone glide ability to move through the creature.

action.name: Shattering Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) bludgoning damage. A {@condition restrained} or {@condition petrified} creature takes an additional {@dice 4d6} (14) damage. If this damage reduces a {@condition petrified} creature to 0 HP, it shatters.

action.name: Hands from Stone
entries: While the maedar is burrowing through stone, it may reach out and grab a creature. One creature within 5 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled}. While grappling a creature in this way, the maedar's speed is 0 and it has three quarters cover.

reaction.name: Mighty Shove
entries: As a reaction to a creature missing the maedar with a melee attack, the maedar may force the creature to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet and fall {@condition prone}. If the creature was averting its gaze and ends this movement within 10 feet of a medusa, the creature must immediately save against its gaze.

trait.name: Shapechanging Mimic
entries: As a bonus action, the leucrotta can Polymorph into any Medium or Large beast, or back to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form.
It can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Man-Taker
entries: A creature that mounts the leucrotta must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the leucrotta for as long as it is mounted, and the leucrotta can't target the creature with attacks. While {@condition charmed}, a creature is unable to voluntarily dismount.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the leucrotta reduces a creature to 0 hit points on its turn, the leucrotta can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Hit-and-Run
entries: If the leucrotta ends its turn more than 30 ft. from any hostile creature, it may take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leucrotta makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Jagged Steel Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer a bleeding wound. At the beginning of each of its turns, a bleeding creature loses 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points, then repeats this saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the creature can't make attacks of opportunity this turn.

action.name: Buck
entries: The leucrotta throws a creature that is mounting it from its back, knocking it {@condition prone}. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the leucrotta's next turn.

reaction.name: Disquieting Cackle
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the leucrotta moves up to 20 ft. without provoking attacks of opportunity, emitting an unsettling laugh. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to move closer to the leucrotta this turn.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The leucrotta can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the leucrotta reduces a creature to 0 hit points on its turn, the leucrotta can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

trait.name: Hit-and-Run
entries: If the leucrotta ends its turn more than 30 ft. from any hostile creature, it may take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leucrotta makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Jagged Steel Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer a bleeding wound. At the beginning of each of its turns, a bleeding creature loses 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points, then repeats this saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the creature can't make attacks of opportunity this turn.

reaction.name: Disquieting Cackle
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the leucrotta moves up to 20 ft. without provoking attacks of opportunity, emitting an unsettling laugh. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to move closer to the leucrotta this turn.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The lamia can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lamia makes three attacks: one with its constrict, one with its dagger, and one with its beguiling touch.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the lamia can't constrict another target.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is magically Cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom Saving Throws and all Ability Checks.

action.name: Beguiling Touch
entries: One target creature within 5 feet must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has its wisdom score reduced by {@dice 1d6} and it uses its reaction to move up to half its speed and make an attack against a creature of the lamia's choice. A creature that has its wisdom score reduced to 0 with this ability is {@condition charmed} by the lamia and placed under its control. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

reaction.name: Torn Loyalty
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with a spell or attack, the lamia may force a creature within 5 feet that is cursed by it to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes the new target of the spell or attack.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The lamia can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lamia makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its dagger or beguiling touch.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is magically Cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom Saving Throws and all Ability Checks.

action.name: Beguiling Touch
entries: One target creature within 5 feet must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has its wisdom score reduced by {@dice 1d6} and it uses its reaction to move up to half its speed and make an attack against a creature of the lamia's choice. A creature that has its wisdom score reduced to 0 with this ability is {@condition charmed} by the lamia and placed under its control. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

reaction.name: Torn Loyalty
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with a spell or attack, the lamia may force a creature within 5 feet that is cursed by it to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes the new target of the spell or attack.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 2 1/2-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Gnashing Horde
entries: Any non-kruthik creature that starts its turn adjacent to one or more kruthiks takes 1 piercing damage per adjacent kruthik.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kruthik makes two stab attacks or two spike attacks.

action.name: Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and the target's movement speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Agitate The Swarm
entries: For the next turn, the gnashing horde ability of kruthiks within 60 feet deals an additional {@damage 1d4} piercing damage per adjacent kruthik.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The kruthik sprays acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 2 1/2-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Gnashing Horde
entries: Any creature other than a kruthic that starts its turn adjacent to one or more kruthiks takes 1 piercing damage per adjacent kruthik.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kruthik makes two stab attacks or two spike attacks.

action.name: Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and the target's movement speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 2 1/2-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Gnashing Horde
entries: Any creature other than a kruthic that starts its turn adjacent to one or more kruthiks takes 1 piercing damage per adjacent kruthik.

action.name: Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: While the kraken remains motionless,  it is indistinguishable from natural terrain to observers more than 30 feet away.

trait.name: Boneless
entries: The kraken can move through a space as narrow as 10 feet wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Implacable
entries: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. If it does, it loses 25 hit points.

trait.name: Eternal Titan
entries: When the kraken is reduced to 0 HP, it does not die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, it cannot take actions other than to dash unless it is in its lair. While at 0 HP and in its lair, it can killed by collapsing its lair with an {@spell Earthquake} spell or equivalent magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling, and attacks once with its bite.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature's attacks bypass the kraken's resistances and it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken. At the start of each of the kraken's turns, each swallowed creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken regurgitates all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the kraken.

action.name: Tentacle Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 30 foot radius around the kraken must succed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity Saving Throw or take 91 ({@damage 26d6}) bludgeoning damage and be shoved 20 feet back, or half damage on a success.

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack or Fling
entries: The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

legendary.name: Blanket
entries: Each creature within 50 feet of the kraken must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} by one of its tentacles.

legendary.name: Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the kraken. Each creature other than the kraken that ends its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the kraken's next turn.

trait.name: Tentacles
entries: The kraken has 10 tentacles, each of which behaves as a seperate creature that acts on the kraken's initiative and have the following properties:

items.name: Length
entries: Each tentacle is 100 feet long.

items.name: Hit Points
entries: Each tentacle has AC 18 and 75 hit points. When reduced to 0 hit points, the tentacle drops anything it is grappling and retreats to the kraken's body.

items.name: Resistances and Immunities
entries: Each tentacle has Immunity to Lightning damage and Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing From Nonmagical Attacks

items.name: Movement
entries: Each tentacle has a speed of 15 feet.

items.name: Senses
entries: Each tentacle has blindsight 5 ft, and is blind beyond that radius.

items.name: Grappling
entries: The tentacle may grapple one creature or object each turn (escape {@dc 18}). A creature may make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw to avoid this grapple. A tentacle may grapple multiple creatures or objects. If the tentacle crosses the full deck of a ship or encounters a mast, it may grapple the ship.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Implacable
entries: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. If it does, it loses 25 hit points.

trait.name: Eternal Titan
entries: When the kraken is reduced to 0 HP, it does not die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, it cannot take actions other than to dash unless it is in its lair. While at 0 HP and in its lair, it can killed by collapsing its lair with an {@spell Earthquake} spell or equivalent magic.

action.name: Surface
entries: The kraken surfaces, creating a huge tidal wave. Each creature without cover must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity save or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed overboard. A creature that is not surprised makes this save at advantage if it uses its reaction to clutch onto something sturdy.

action.name: Clutch
entries: The kraken grips a ship, reducing its movement to 0. While it has a ship clutched in this way, it is has full cover from creatures on the ship.

action.name: Crush
entries: Each creature and object the kraken's tentacles have {@condition grappled} takes 20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. A ship {@condition grappled} by two or more tentacles must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw (a typical sailing ship has +3 to this roll) or begin to split.

action.name: Capsize
entries: The kraken capsizes a ship that has begun to split. Each creature on board or {@condition grappled} by the tentacles must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or fall into the kraken's mouth and be swallowed as the ship is ripped apart.

action.name: Submerge
entries: The kraken descends up to 60 feet, leaving a massive whirlpool in its wake that lasts for a minute, 250 feet wide and 25 feet deep. A creature or object that starts its turn in the vortex must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pulled 20 feet towards its center, take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage, and be trapped. While trapped, a creature or object cannot move away from the center, but can use its action to repeat this save, freeing itself on a success.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. A creature can attempt to avoid harming the heads, bypassing this trait. If it does, the hydra has resistance to any damage it deals.

At the beginning of its turn, the hydra makes a {@dc 12} Constitution save for each head that died since its last turn. On a success, it grows two new heads. It makes one of these saves at disadvantage for each source of fire damage it took since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads. If it is grappling a creature at the start of its turn, it may replace one of its bite attacks with a swallow.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. While a head grapples a target, the head can attack only that target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The hydra makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition grappled} in the hydra's craw, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the hydra, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the hydra's turns. One swallowed creature is freed whenever the hydra loses a head.

action.name: Worry
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by at least two hydra heads must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage, or half as much on a success. A creature makes this save at disadvantage if it is {@condition grappled} by three or more hydra heads.

reaction.name: Shed Head
entries: When the hydra fails a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, as a reaction it may choose to succeed. If it does, one of its heads dies and tears away from the main body.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The hook horror can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.  If the hook horror takes thunder damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Ceiling Dropper
entries: The hook horror can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. It reduces any fall damage it would take by 10.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hook horror makes two hook attacks. If both attack hit the same target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12})

action.name: Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. This attack does an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each 10 feet the hook horror fell this turn.

action.name: Fling
entries: The hook horror flings a {@condition grappled} creature up to 30 feet. If the creature hits a wall, it takes 18 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage and must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the hook horror's next turn. If the creature hits another creature, each creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The griffon has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the griffon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Vicious Dive
entries: If the hippogriff is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hippogriff makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the harpy is flying and dives at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack scores a critical on an 19 or 20.

trait.name: Snatcher
entries: The harpy may choose not to be slowed by carrying a medium or smaller creature on its turn. If it does, it releases its grapple at the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The harpy makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Wrenching Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}. On a critical hit, the target is knocked {@condition prone} and cannot stand on its following turn.

action.name: Deadly Screech
entries: The harpy lets out a dreadful screech. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and must move directly toward the nearest hazardous terrain it can see, or away from the harpy if it can't see any hazardous terrain. A {@condition frightened} creature may repeat this save whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Take Flight
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee attack, the harpy moves up to half its fly speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

reaction.name: Jink
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a ranged attack while at least 10 feet in the air, the harpy may halve the attack's damage.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the harpy is flying and dives at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack scores a critical on an 19 or 20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The harpy makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Vicous Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of the harpy's next turn.

action.name: Luring Song (concentration)
entries: The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the harpy stops singing or is {@condition incapacitated}. The harpy may continue the song as a bonus action on each of its turns.

While {@condition charmed} by the harpy, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the songs of other harpies. On its turn, it moves by the most direct availble route toward the harpy. A {@condition charmed} target repeats saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Take Flight
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee attack, the harpy moves up to half its fly speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

reaction.name: Jink
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a ranged attack while at least 10 feet in the air, the harpy may halve the attack's damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The gulon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Concussive Strength
entries: A creature knocked {@condition prone} by the gulon cannot stand on its following turn.

trait.name: Opportunistic Feeeder
entries: The gulon scores a critical on a 16-20 against a {@condition prone} creature.

trait.name: Quick Squeeze
entries: The gulon may move through any space larger than its skull without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gulon makes one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Ravenous Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the gulon gains 25 temporary HP. While it has this temporary HP, its speed is 15 ft. and it can't use its Multiattack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Disgorge
entries: Each creature in a 15 ft. cone must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, or half as much on a success. If the gulon had any temporary hit points, it loses them and this ability does an additonal 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage to a creature that fails its save.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Gold Seeder
entries: The bones of fallen griffons have a spontaneous tendency to transmute tiny flecks of the surrounding  material to gold. This process is too slow to be exploited directly, but ancient griffon nests are often ready sources of gold ore.

trait.name: Diving Overrun
entries: If the griffon is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the target must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the griffon can grapple the target (escape {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The grick has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Perpetually Ravenous
entries: While the grick has an {@condition incapacitated} creature {@condition grappled}, it may make a beak attack against that creature as a bonus action. It may drag a medium or smaller {@condition incapacitated} creature without expending additional movement.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Thrash
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the grick must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the grick's next turn, or half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Imprint
entries: A creature native to the gray render's territory may attempt a {@dc 25} Wisdom (Animal Handling) check to befriend the gray render. On a critical success, the gray render imprints on the creature, treating it as a family member to be nurtured and protected.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The gray render has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gray render makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Dismembering Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) piercing damage. This attack does an additional 17 ({@damage 3d12}) damage to a {@condition prone} creature. If this attack deals more than half the target's hit points, the target must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or lose a limb and drop to 0 hit points.

action.name: Rending Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and unable to stand until the end of the gray render's next turn. On a critical hit, nonmagical leather armor the target is wearing is destroyed.

reaction.name: Bloody Rampage
entries: As a reaction to taking 20 or more damage from a single source, the gray render lets out an enraged bellow, adding one claw attack to its multiattack, cumulatively, for the next minute.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the gorgon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the gorgon can make one attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Reckless Follow-Through
entries: At the start of its turn, the gorgon can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn. If it misses with an attack this turn, it is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thrashing Horns
entries: Two creatures on opposite sides of the gorgon must each succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 3d12}) piercing damage and be pushed 10 feet away, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Petrifying Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The gorgon exhales petrifying gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

trait.name: Keen Scent
entries: The girallon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on scent, and can detect the presence of creatures up to 120 ft. away.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the girallon can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Bowl Over
entries: If the girallon moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The girallon makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit. reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the girallon can grapple the target (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Slam
entries: The girallon slams two {@condition grappled} creatures into each other. The creatures must each succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution Saving Throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the girallon's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Hurl
entries: The girallon hurls a {@condition grappled} creature up to 30 feet. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Shock Susceptibility
entries: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a -2 penality to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can't use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both.

trait.name: Toxic Secretions
entries: A creature that makes an attack that benefits from flanking the froghemoth must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or suffer 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the froghemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The froghemoth makes two attacks with its tentacles and one with its bite. It can replace its bite with a use of its Tongue or Lob Mucous

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns. The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tongue
entries: The froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth, and the froghemoth can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Lob Mucous
entries: The froghemoth expels a large glob of mucous, covering a 20-foot radius area within 60 feet. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity Saving Throw or suffer several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a -2 penality to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can't use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. A creature in the froghemoth's gullet when it uses this ability may attempt a {@dc 16} Athletics or Acrobatics check. On a success, the creature is launched out with mucous and must immediately save against it.

reaction.name: Legendary Reactions
entries: The froghemoth may make a legendary reaction whenever its conditions are met, without using its reaction.

reaction.name: Fling
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack by a {@condition grappled} creature, the froghemoth may throw the creature up to 40 feet away. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a success.

reaction.name: Reel
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a ranged attack by a {@condition grappled} creature, the froghemoth may pull the creature up to 20 feet straight towards it.

reaction.name: Slam
entries: As a reaction to a creature casting a spell that targets the froghemoth, the froghemoth may lift the creature and slam it into the ground. The creature must make a {@dc 17} constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a succcess. If the creature was concentrating on a spell, it makes its save to maintain concentration at disadvantage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Shock Susceptibility
entries: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a -2 penality to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can't use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both.

trait.name: Toxic Secretions
entries: A creature that makes an attack that benefits from flanking the froghemoth must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or suffer 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The froghemoth makes two attacks with its tentacles and one with its bite. It can replace its bite with a use of its Tongue or Lob Mucous

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns. The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tongue
entries: The froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth, and the froghemoth can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Lob Mucous
entries: The froghemoth expels a large glob of mucous, covering a 20-foot radius area within 60 feet. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity Saving Throw or suffer several effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, it takes a -2 penality to AC and Dexterity saving throws, it can't use reactions or Multiattack, and on its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. A creature in the froghemoth's gullet when it uses this ability may attempt a {@dc 16} Athletics or Acrobatics check. On a success, the creature is launched out with mucous and must immediately save against it.

reaction.name: Fling
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack by a {@condition grappled} creature, the froghemoth may throw the creature up to 40 feet away. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a success.

reaction.name: Reel
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a ranged attack by a {@condition grappled} creature, the froghemoth may pull the creature up to 20 feet straight towards it.

reaction.name: Slam
entries: As a reaction to a creature casting a spell that targets the froghemoth, the froghemoth may lift the creature and slam it into the ground. The creature must make a {@dc 16} constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a succcess. If the creature was concentrating on a spell, it makes its save to maintain concentration at disadvantage.

trait.name: Spiderlike
entries: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings and across webs, without penalty. While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Trapdoor
entries: Over the course of an hour, the ettercap can construct a trapdoor of web and debris that makes an opening up to 10 feet across indistinguishable from natural terrain.

trait.name: Spider Trainer
entries: Whenever a friendly spider within 30 feet makes an attack roll or a saving throw, it can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the result.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with either its Bite or Silken Noose, if available.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. This attack deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a surprised creature.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Silken Noose {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing (escape {@dc 12}). While {@condition restrained} in this way, the ettercap may drag the {@condition restrained} creature 15 feet toward it at the beginning of each of the ettercap's turns.

trait.name: Spiderlike
entries: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings and across webs, without penalty. While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with either its Bite or Silken Noose, if available.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing (escape {@dc 11}). While {@condition restrained} in this way, the ettercap may drag the {@condition restrained} creature 15 feet toward it at the beginning of each of the ettercap's turns.

trait.name: Spiderlike
entries: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings and across webs, without penalty. While in contact with a web, the drider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Lurker in the Dark
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the drider has advantage on all attacks, and scores a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drider makes three attacks in any combination with its Bite, Silkblade, and Longbow. It may replace one of those attacks with a use of its Douse ability, if available..

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Silkblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target is magically {@condition restrained} by webbing if it is a medium or smaller creature (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Douse {@recharge 5}
entries: The drider magically douses all lights in a 20 foot radius centered on a point within 60 feet. If the drider is hidden, this action does not reveal its position.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Exploit Weakness
entries: Attack rolls the doppelganger makes with advantage deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage.

trait.name: Mind Reader
entries: The doppelganger can magically read the surface thoughts of  creatures within 60 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doppelganger makes two slam attacks and uses its perfect replica ability.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) knuppelschade.

action.name: Perfect Replica
entries: A creature within 5 feet of the doppelganger must make a {@dc 15} Constitution Saving Throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of the doppelganger's next turn, and the doppleganger takes on its appearance. While the doppelganger is adjacent to a {@condition stunned} creature whose appearance it is mimicking, attack rolls directed at it have a 50% chance of hitting the copied creature instead. A creature that fails this save becomes immune to the effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Cloud Mind (concentration)
entries: The doppelganger becomes {@condition invisible} to creatures within 15 feet of it for the next hour, or until it makes an attack or casts a spell.

reaction.name: Uncanny Mimicry
entries: As a reaction to seeing a creature taking an action, the doppleganger may memorize that action. On its next turn, it may take that action. If the action included a weapon, the doppleganger grows an appendage to mimic it. If the action was to cast a spell, the doppleganger can cast it innately without a spell slot, using the mimicked creature's attack bonus and save DC.

trait.name: Shapechanger

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Mind Reader
entries: The doppelganger can magically read the surface thoughts of  creatures within 60 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam

reaction.name: Uncanny Mimicry

If the action included a weapon, the doppelganger grows an appendage to mimic it. If the action was to cast a spell, the doppelganger cast it innately without a spell slot, using the mimicked creature's attack bonus and save DC.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The dolgrim has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Double Actions
entries: The dolgrim rolls initiative twice, and acts on each of them.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The dolgrim can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Flail {@recharge}
entries: The dolgrim makes three weapon attacks at disadvantage.

reaction.name: Slippery
entries: If an attack misses the dolgrim, it can move up to 5 feet as a reaction without provoking attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails .

trait.name: Displacement
entries: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the displacer beast can hide as a bonus action

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the displacer beast moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw Attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the displacer beast can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The displacer beast makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

reaction.name: Slink
entries: As a reaction to a creature ending its movement within 5 feet of the displacer beast, it may move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Slam
entries: As a reaction to a creature it has {@condition grappled} hitting it with an attack the displacer beast may lift it into the air and slam it to the ground. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the displacer beast's next turn.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is {@condition blinded} and can't breathe breathe, and the darkmantle has advantage on attacks against it and cannot bite another target. If this attack was made with advantage, the creature loses its breath if it was holding it.

reaction.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, the darkmantle exhudes a 15-foot radius of magical darkness that moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts until the next time the darkmantle takes damage.

trait.name: Nondetection
entries: The cat cannot be targeted or detected by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

trait.name: Righting Reflex
entries: The cat takes no fall damage if it falls from a height of 30 ft. or greater.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cat moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cat can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Spell Turning
entries: As a reaction to succeeding on a saving throw against a spell of 7th level or lower that targets only it, the cat avoids all effects from the spell and instead causes the spell to target the caster.

reaction.name: Bat Away
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the cat forces the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or have one object it is holding knocked out of its hands and 15 ft. away.

trait.name: Clumsy Flier
entries: The cockatrice falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed. Attacks it makes while airborne are made at disadvantage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw against being magically {@condition petrified}. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained} until the end of the cockatrice's next turn. If the target was already {@condition restrained} in this way, on a failed save it is instead {@condition petrified} for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Buffetting Wings
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the cockatrice may force the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The cockatrice may then move up to half its speed as part of this reaction.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: The chimera has three reactions each round. Whenever it takes 20 or more damage from a single source it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose one of its reactions.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the chimera fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite.

action.name: Gnashing Bite

action.name: Claws

entries: The dragon head exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Headbutt
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a melee attack, the chimera may force the attacker to succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the chimera's next turn.

reaction.name: Rake
entries: As a reaction to a creature entering its reach, the chimera may make a claws attack against it. If the attack hits, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Roar
entries: As a reaction to being hit with a ranged attack, the chimera may let out a terrifying roar. Each creature within 60 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the chimera until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Claw Attack
entries: The chimera makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chimera beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the chimera must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.
