entries: A sleeping creature that starts its turn within 30 ft. of the feyr is accosted by its deepest fears, and takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. This damage does not wake a sleeping creature. A creature reduced to 0 hit points in this way gains 1 hit point and rises on its turn under the feyr's control.
A creature under the feyr's control makes a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a succeess.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While the feyr is illuminated with bright light, attacks against the it are made at advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The feyr makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Gnashing Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. This attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psyschic damage to a {@condition frightened} creature.

action.name: Tendril Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Torment Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 60 ft. long, 5 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} for the next minute, or take half as much damage on a success. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Insubstantiate
entries: As a reaction to taking 15 or more damage from a single source, the feyr disappears into the border ethereal. At the begining of its its next turn, the feyr teleports back into the material plane within 30 ft. of where it departed.

trait.name: Aura of Terror
entries: A sleeping creature that starts its turn within 30 ft. of the feyr is accosted by its deepest fears, and takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. This damage does not wake a sleeping creature. A creature reduced to 0 hit points in this way gains 1 hit point and rises on its turn under the feyr's control.
A creature under the feyr's control makes a {@dc 9} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a succeess.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While the feyr is illuminated with bright light, attacks against the it are made at advantage.

action.name: Lulling Gaze
entries: One creature within 30 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 9} Wisdom saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more falls asleep for the next minute.
A creature wakes up early if it takes damage or another creature uses its action to wake it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Non-Euclidian
entries: The space in a 15 foot radius around the elder brain is difficult terrain, as the elder brain's presence warps it into incomprehensible geometries.

trait.name: Tendrils
entries: The elder brain can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points), or destroyed by forcing the tethered creature to move more than 30 ft. from the elder brain. Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the elder brain, which can extrude a replacement tendril as part of an attack.

trait.name: Exposed Brain
entries: The elder brain has a telepathic field that grants it resistace to all damage but psychic, which it must concentrate on as though concentrating on a spell. If it loses concentration, until the beginning of its next turn it loses its damage resistances.

action.name: Synaptic Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or fall under the elder brain's control and be unable to move more than 30 ft. away from it as the brain tethers it. This control ends if the tendril is severed.

A creature tethered to the elder brain takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns and has its Wisdom score reduced by the same amount, to a minimum of 1. If this reduces the {@condition charmed} creature to 1 Wisdom, the elder brain no longer requires the tether to control the creature. This reduction lasts until the creature completes a short or long rest.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elder brain magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot radius. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage and have its proficiency bonus reduced to 0 for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Plane Shift (7th level spell, 1/day)
entries: The elder brain teleports to another plane of existence.

reaction.name: Die For Your Master
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with an attack or spell, the elder brain may force a creature within 15 feet that it has under its control to use its reaction to move up to half its speed toward the elder brain, becoming the new target of the attack or spell if it ends this movement adjacent to the elder brain.

reaction.name: Psychic Keen (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 106 hit points, the elder brain lets out a telepathic wail. Each creature within 60 ft. with a proficiency bonus of 0 must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the elder brain's next turn.

legendary.name: Tendril (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder brain makes a synaptic tendril attack.

legendary.name: Form Psychic Link
entries: One {@condition incapacitated} creature within 5 miles must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or have the elder brain form a psychic link to it. This link ends if the creature leaves the radius, or with a Remove Curse or similar magic. While linked, the elder brain can see through the creature's eyes and read its surface thoughts.

legendary.name: Mind Master
entries: The elder brain causes any number of creatures it has a psychic link to use their reactions to move up to 15 ft. in the same direction. A creature directed to move into damaging terrain may first attempt a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, ending the link and taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage on a success.

legendary.name: Break Concentration
entries: One creature the elder brain has a psychic link to loses concentration on a spell it has cast.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the dolgaunt is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the dolgaunt instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Coordinated Advance
entries: The dolgaunt acts on initiative count 10, instead of rolling initiative. Creatures with this trait share a turn, taking their actions and movement in any order.

trait.name: Drillmaster
entries: Friendly hobgoblins within 30 feet of the dolgaunt use its attack bonus, rather than their own.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dolgaunt makes four melee attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The dolgaunt has two tentacles that can each grapple a single target.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Vitality Leech
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by a tentacle of the dolgaunt must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or have its Constitution score reduced by {@dice 1d6} for the next minute. The dolgaunt gains 5 temporary hit points for each point the creature's Constitution was reduced by.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While grappling a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and can't use its Phantasms ability.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cloaker makes four attacks: one with its bite and three with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). While {@condition grappled}, the target is {@condition blinded} and can't breathe, and the cloaker has advantage on attacks against it and cannot bite another target. If this attack was made with advantage, the creature loses its breath if it was holding it.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Phantasms
entries: As a reaction to being hit with an attack or harmful spell, the cloaker rolls a {@dice D20}. On a roll of 11-20, the attack or spell hits an illusory echo of the cloaker instead.

reaction.name: Moan (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 39 HP, the cloaker may force each non-aberration creature within 60 feet that can hear it to succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the cloaker's next turn.

trait.name: Aberrant Quickness
entries: The choker may dash as a bonus action while it has a creature {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Boneless
entries: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The choker is {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 30 feet away from it.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The choker makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappied (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and can't speak or breathe, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles.

action.name: Throttle
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the choker must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage, run out of breath, and start suffocating.

monster.name: Chuul
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The chuul can breathe air and water

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The chuul senses magic within 120 feet of it. It can't be surprised by creatures carrying magic items.

trait.name: Brittle Shell
entries: If the chuul takes 15 or more bludgeoning damage from a single source, its AC is reduced to 13 until it completes a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chuul makes two attacks: one with its seizer claw and one with its crusher claw. If the chuul is grappling a creature, the chuul can also use its tentacles once.

action.name: Seizer Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and dragged up to 5 feet towards the chuul. The chuul can grapple only a single target at a time.

action.name: Crusher Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls that use Strength until it completes a short or long rest.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the chuul must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, attacks that target the creature score a critical on a 15-20. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Psychic Static (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 46 hit points, the chuul forces each creature within 10 feet of it to succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage. A creature with telepathy makes this saving throw at disadvantage.

trait.name: Read Bones
entries: By carefully examining the bones of a creature, the berbalang can extract any secrets it knew in life.

trait.name: Dream Travel
entries: While the berbalang sleeps, its spirit leaves its body. In spirit form, the berbalang has the same statistics, except that its attacks deal psychic damage instead of any other type and it can teleport to another plane as an action. If the berbalang dies in spirit form, its body dies.

trait.name: Weak Flier
entries: While grappling a creature larger than size Small, the berbalang cannot fly unless the creature is also {@condition grappled} by one of its duplicates.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or reveal one of its secrets to the berbalang.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Absorb Duplicate
entries: The berbalang absorbs one of its duplicates, destroying it and gaining 20 Temporary hit points.

action.name: Detonate Duplicate
entries: The berbalang detonates one of its duplicates. Each creature within 20 ft. of the duplicate must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage.

bonus.name: Duplicate Self
entries: If the berbalang has at least 20 hit points, the berbalang creates a duplicate of itself, reducing its current hit points by 1/4. The duplicate has hit points equal to those lost in its creation, and acts on the berbalang's initiative.

trait.name: Psychic Tether Cone
entries: The mindwitness' central eye creates an area of psychic intermingling in a 150-foot cone. Whenever the mindwitness makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against a magical effect, each creature in the cone must make the same saving throw against the effect. At the start of each of its turns, the mindwitness decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mindwitness makes three attacks, one of which may be with its bite. It may replace any number of these with a randomly selected Eye Ray (reroll duplicates).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). A creature {@condition grappled} in this way takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns and has its Intelligence score reduced by the same amount until the grapple ends. A creature with an Intelligence of 0 is {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 ft. of it:

action.name: 1. Telekinetic Ray (Opalescent White)
entries: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 ft. in any direction. An object weighing 300 lbs or less is moved 30 ft. in any direction.

action.name: 2. Apathy Ray (Fuzzy Grey)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved until the end of its next turn. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

action.name: 3. Stunning Ray (Pulsing Maroon)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: 4. Psychic Disruption Ray (Pale Silver)
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and lose concentration, if it was holding it.

action.name: 5. Paranoia Ray (Wavy Purple.)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom Saving Throw or become {@condition frightened} of one of its allies until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, it cannot willingly accept assistance from that ally.

action.name: 6. Aversion Ray (Sickly Yellow)
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be unable to use an object it carries of the mindwitness' choice without mental anguish for the next minute. If the mindwitness chooses a weapon or spell focus, whenever the creature uses the object to cast a spell or make an attack, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. If the mindwitness chose a shield, whenever an attack misses the creature, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.

variant.name: Note: What Makes a Good Beholder Fight?
entries: For me, the fun of a beholder fight as a player is in gradually working out what each eye beam does, and in the terror that comes when you get hit with one that you know is one of the bad ones, having brilliantly worked out for yourself how absolutely screwed you are. To that end, I recommend describing the appearance and effect of each ray, only using the ray's name once you're sure the players have figured it out.

variant.name: Note: Shifting the Balance
entries: Minions can be a lot to manage with a high-complexity monster like the beholder. Here's how I'd buff a beholder fight if the need arose:
Make its lair more hazardous and generally unfriendly to people bound by gravity. Give it traps it can fling the PCs into, awkward geometry, high-up hidey-holes to seek cover in.
Choose targets after rolling the eye rays. You can really lean into the evil mastermind angle by always target a PC that is likely to fail the save.

trait.name: Spacial Distortion Cone
entries: The Eye Tyrant's central eye creates an area of spacial distortion in a 150 ft. cone. A creature attempting a ranged attack that passes through the cone must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom Saving Throw, or its attack is immediately redirected to another target of the beholder's choice that shifts its trajectory no more than 90 degrees. Melee attacks made from within the cone have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The beholder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Many Eyes (5/Day)
entries: If the beholder fails a saving throw against an effect that would blind it, it may choose to succeed instead. The beholder takes one fewer legendary action each turn for each time it has used this ability.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 ft. of it:

action.name: 1. Gravity Shift Ray (Opalescent White)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity Saving Throw, or fall 100ft in a direction of the beholder's choice as gravity shifts for it until the end of the beholder's next turn.

action.name: 2. Psychic Blast Ray (Swirling Red)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence Saving Throw or take {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and have its intelligence score reduced by {@dice 1d6}, or half damage on a success. A creature is {@condition stunned} if reduced to 0 Intelligence until it regains at least one point of Intelligence.

action.name: 3. Mind Killer Ray (Wavy Purple.)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom Saving Throw or become {@condition frightened}. The creature repeats this save at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success or taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage on a failure.

action.name: 4. Dispel Ray (Pale Silver)
entries: The beholder ends one spell affecting the target.

action.name: 5. Melt Flesh Ray (Mottled Green)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or have its current and maximum HP reduced by 22 ({@dice 4d10}), and its flesh begins to melt. Roll a {@dice d4} to determine which feature sloughs off: 1. ears, 2. lips, 3. eyelids, 4. nose.

action.name: 6. Blood Ray (Sludgy Crimson)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become succeptible to bleeding for the next minute. Whenever the afflicted character takes damage, they begin bleeding, losing 10 HP at the start of each of their turns. They stop bleeding when magically healed, or with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom (Medicine) check, but retain their susceptibility. This can be applied to the same creature multiple times, with its effects applied cumulatively.

action.name: 7. Slowing Ray (Sickly Yellow)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: 8. Entomb Ray (Jagged Blue)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength Saving Thrwo or be {@condition restrained} as the floor beneath it begins to churn and grasping stony hands reach out to drag it down. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, it escapes and the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is buried alive. The creature may repeat this save on subsequent turns as an action, escaping on a success. Another creature may attempt a {@dc 16} Strength (athletics) check as an action to rescue the target.

action.name: 9. Betrayal Ray (Blotchy Gray)
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma Saving Throw or a shadowy simulacra is created of the target in a space adjacent to it. It acts on the target's initiative directly after it and has the same stats and abilities as the target, except that it has 15 max HP. If a character's shadow clone reduces them to zero HP with a melee attack, it posesses their {@condition unconscious} body.

action.name: 10. Death Ray (Streaky Black)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity Saving Throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

legendary.name: Ray Burst (Costs 3 actions)
entries: The beholder focuses all of its eye rays into its distortion cone, scattering them all at random. Each other creature within 120 ft. is targeted with a random eye ray (rerolling duplicates), but with the save DC reduced to 12. Until the beginning of its next turn, creatures have advantage on the Wisdom Saving Throw imposed by the beholder's distortion cone.

trait.name: Negative Energy Cone
entries: The death tyrant's central eye emits an {@condition invisible}, magical 150-foot cone of negative energy. At the start of each of its turns, the tyrant decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

Any creature in that area can't regain hit points. Any humanoid that dies there becomes a zombie under the tyrant's command. The dead humanoid retains its place in the initiative order and animates at the start of its next turn, provided that its body hasn't been completely destroyed.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death tyrant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Many Eyes (5/Day)
entries: If the death tyrant fails a saving throw against an effect that would blind or incapacitate it, it may choose to succeed instead. The death tyrant takes one fewer legendary action each turn for each time it has used this ability.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The death tyrant shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 ft. of it:

action.name: 1. Decay Ray (Luminescent Green)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity Saving Throw or have its maximum hit points reduced to its current hit points until it completes a long rest.

action.name: 2. Compulsion Ray (Wispy Red)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom Saving Throw or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage and be unable to voluntarily leave the death tyrant's eye cone until the end of its next turn.

action.name: 3. Terror Ray (Wavy Purple.)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom Saving Throw or become {@condition frightened} for the next minute. The creature repeats this save at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success or taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage on a failure.

action.name: 4. Dispel Ray (Pale Silver)
entries: The death tyrant ends one spell affecting the target.

action.name: 5. Seizure Ray (Mottled Green)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for the next minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, whenever the creature casts a spell it is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn. A {@condition poisoned} creature repeats this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: 6. Blood Ray (Sludgy Crimson)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution Saving Throw or become succeptible to bleeding for the next minute. Whenever the afflicted character takes damage, they begin bleeding, losing 10 HP at the start of each of their turns. They stop bleeding when magically healed, or with a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom (Medicine) check, but retain their susceptibility. This can be applied to the same creature multiple times, with its effects applied cumulatively.

action.name: 7. Etherealness Ray (Diaphanous White)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity Saving Throw. On a failed save, the target is shunted partially into the ethereal plane, gaining a 30 ft. fly speed and dealing half as much damage with attacks that use Strength for the next minute.

action.name: 8. Enchaining Ray (Gleaming Blue-Grey)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength Saving Throw or be {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 16}) as chains of seething shadow envelop its body. A creature in bright light may attempt to escape as a bonus action.

action.name: 9. Doom Ray (Shivering Marroon)
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma Saving Throw or be cursed. While cursed, the creature acquires a Doom counter each time it takes necrotic damage. If the creature drops to 0 hit points while cursed, it immediately fails one Death Save for each Doom counter it has.

action.name: 10. Death Ray (Streaky Black)
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity Saving Throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The death tyrant uses one random eye ray.

legendary.name: Death Ray (Costs 3 actions)
entries: The death tyrant uses its Death Ray.

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
entries: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the {@spell {@spell antimagic field}} spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The beholder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Many Eyes (3/Day)
entries: If the beholder fails a saving throw against an effect that would blind it, it may choose to succeed instead. The beholder takes one fewer legendary action each turn for each time it has used this ability.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 ft. of it:

action.name: 1. Charm Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.

action.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: 3. Fear Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: 4. Slowing Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: 5. Enervation Ray
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: 6. Telekinetic Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 ft. in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 ft. in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

action.name: 7. Sleep Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

action.name: 8. Petrification Ray
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

action.name: 9. Disintegration Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

action.name: 10. Death Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 5d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the balhannoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Dead Magic Grip
entries: A creature {@condition grappled} by the balhannoth that attempts to cast a spell with a Casting Time of 1 action must first roll a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take Effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell.

trait.name: Superior Camouflage
entries: The balhannoth is {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 10 feet away from it. It may attempt to hide without cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The balhannoth makes a bite attack and up to two tentacle attacks, or it makes up to four tentacle attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and is moved up to 5 feet toward the balhannoth. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the balhannoth can't use this tentacle against other targets. The balhannoth has four tentacles.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Attack The balhannoth makes one bite attack against one creature it has {@condition grappled}.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The balhannoth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying and any creatures it has {@condition grappled}, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Drain Magic
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the balhannoth must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitiution saving throw or lose its highest level expended spell slot. The balhannoth gains 4 ({@dice 1d8}) temporary hit points for each spell level expended this way.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Viscous Mucous
entries: While underwater, the area in a 15 foot radius around the Aboleth counts as difficult terrain for non-aberrations. Creatures affected by the mucous who attempt to make an attack other than their first on a turn must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength Saving Throw. On a failure, the attack fails.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the aboleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes four tentacle attacks. It may replace up to two of these with its Compel or Dominate abilities.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution Saving Throw or become diseased. A diseased creature can only breathe water and can't regain hit points while outside of water. After 1 minute, a diseased creature's skin begins to turn slimy and translucent. If a creature fails this save by 5 or more, the creature gains vulnerability to the next source of bludgeoning damage it takes in the next minute.

action.name: Compel
entries: A creature {@condition charmed} by the Aboleth makes a weapon attack or casts a cantrip targeting a creature of the Aboleth's choice.

action.name: Dominate (Concentration)
entries: 60 ft. range, targets 1 creature the aboleth can see. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom Saving Throw or be magically {@condition charmed} and under the aboleth's control. The {@condition charmed} creature can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If a creature fails this save by 5 or more, they are additionally {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Enslave {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom Saving Throw or take 110 ({@damage 20d10}) psychic damage, or half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the {@condition charmed} creature to 0 HP, it gains 110 ({@dice 20d10}) hit points and the aboleth no longer requires Concentration to Dominate it.

action.name: Tentacle Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 15 foot radius around the aboleth must succed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity Saving Throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) bludgeoning damage and be shoved 20 feet back, or half damage on a success.

reaction.name: Reactive Camoflauge
entries: As a reaction to being reduced to 100 HP or below, the aboleth becomes {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 30 feet away from it. This invisibility lasts for 1 hour, or until the aboleth regains hit points.

legendary.name: Dive
entries: The aboleth moves up to half its movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity. If its Reactive Camoflauge is active, it may then attempt to Hide.

legendary.name: Compel
entries: The aboleth uses its Compel ability.

legendary.name: Mental Fog
entries: One creature within 120 feet of the aboleth must succeed on a {@dc 19} intelligence save. On a failed save, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and subtracts {@dice 1d6} from the next saving throw it makes before the end of the aboleth's next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Defensive Telepathy
entries: A creature that attempts to harm the hatchling must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom Saving Throw or be {@condition charmed} by it for the next minute. A creature {@condition charmed} by the hatchling has disadvantage on Wisdom Saving Throws.

action.name: Weaken Mind
entries: One creature within 30 ft. that the hatchling can see must make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract it from the total of the next saving throw it makes before the end of the hatchling's next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Viscous Mucous
entries: While underwater, the area in a 10 foot radius around the Aboleth counts as difficult terrain for non-aberrations. Creatures affected by the mucous who attempt to make an attack other than their first on a turn must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength Saving Throw. On a failure, the attack fails.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks. It may replace one of these with a use of its Compel or its Dominate action.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Compel
entries: A creature {@condition charmed} by the Aboleth makes a weapon attack or casts a cantrip targeting a creature of the Aboleth's choice.

action.name: Dominate (Concentration)
entries: 30 ft. range, targets 1 creature the aboleth can see. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom Saving Throw or be magically {@condition charmed} and under the aboleth's control. The {@condition charmed} creature can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Enslave {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom Saving Throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage, or half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the {@condition charmed} creature to 0 HP, it gains 55 ({@dice 10d10}) hit points and the aboleth no longer requires Concentration to Dominate it.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the area in a 10 foot radius around the Aboleth counts as difficult terrain for non-aberrations.

entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

entries: The aboleth makes four tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution Saving Throw or become diseased. A diseased creature can only breathe water and can't regain hit points while outside of water. After 1 minute, a diseased creature's skin begins to turn slimy and translucent. If a creature fails this save by 5 or more, the creature gains vulnerability to the next source of bludgeoning damage it takes in the next minute.

action.name: Tentacle Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 15 foot radius around the aboleth must succed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity Saving Throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) bludgeoning damage and be shoved 20 feet back, or half damage on a success.

reaction.name: Reactive Camoflauge
entries: As a reaction to being reduced to 50 HP or below, the aboleth becomes {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 30 feet away from it. This invisibility lasts for 1 hour, or until the aboleth regains hit points.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the area in a 10 foot radius around the Aboleth counts as difficult terrain for non-aberrations.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks. It may replace one of these with a use of its Compel action.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution Saving Throw or become diseased. A diseased creature can only breathe water and can't regain hit points while outside of water. After 1 minute, a diseased creature's skin begins to turn slimy and translucent. If a creature fails this save by 5 or more, the creature gains vulnerability to the next source of bludgeoning damage it takes in the next minute.

action.name: Compel
entries: A creature {@condition charmed} by the Aboleth makes a weapon attack or casts a cantrip targeting a creature of the Aboleth's choice.

action.name: Dominate {@recharge 5}
entries: 30 ft. range, targets 1 creature the aboleth can see. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom Saving Throw or be magically {@condition charmed} and under the aboleth's control. The {@condition charmed} creature can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

disease.name: Filth Fever
entries: A raging fever sweeps through the creature's body. The creature has disadvantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and attack rolls that use Strength. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

disease.name: Slaad Egg
entries: A humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg to term at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a slaad tadpole. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the unborn slaad is disintegrated.

disease.name: Chaos Phage
entries: While infected, the target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) every 24 hours. If the disease reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target instantly transforms into a red slaad or, if it has the ability to cast spells of 3rd level or higher, a green slaad. Only a {@spell wish} spell can reverse the transformation.

disease.name: Flitrot
entries: A creature infected with flitrot sports festering boils, coughs up flies, and sheds rotting skin. An infected creature does not recover spent hit dice on a long rest, and makes death saving throws at disadvantage.

disease.name: Fading Ague
entries: An infected creature takes on a slightly translucent palor, which intensifies as the disease progresses. Whenever an infected creature drops to 0 HP, its Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. If the creature's Constutiton is reduced to 0 it dies and a Specter rises from its corpse.

disease.name: Pthisis
entries: A creature infected with Pthisis cannot hold its breath. Nupperibos in a one mile radius can detect an infected creature by scent.

disease.name: Lockjaw
entries: An infection stiffens the the creature's joints, impeding its ability to speak well. The creature's movement speed is reduced by 5, it has disadvantage on Charisma ability checks, and it must first succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw to perform the verbal components of a spell. On a failed save, the action is wasted.

disease.name: Ophidomycosis
entries: An afflicted creature that can see a creature hostile to it at the start of its turn must succeed on a Wisdom save with DC equal to 10 plus the number of days afflicted or be forced to end its turn closer to the hostile creature than it began. An afflicted creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw at each dawn or have its Wisdom score reduced by {@dice 1d4}, ending the condition and restoring the creature's Wisdom on a success. A creature reduced to 0 Wisdom in this way dies.

disease.name: Greensickness
entries: A creature infected with Greensickness has disadvantage on attacks, ability checks, and saving throws that use Strength. Tiny roots grow out of the creature's wounds, reducing the effect of healing magic that targets the creature by half.

disease.name: Ghoul Fever
entries: A creature with Ghoul Fever cannot recover levels of {@condition exhaustion}, and must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw each time it completes a long rest or acquire a level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature that dies while infected rises immediately as a ghoul.

disease.name: Lyssavirus
entries: An infected creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw at each dawn, or have its Constitution score reduced to the number rolled. A creature that has its Constitution score reduced to 9 or lower in this way is {@condition frightened}. A creature that has its Constitution score reduced to 0 dies.

disease.name: Redding Ague
entries: A creature infected with Redding Ague does not recover points of {@condition exhaustion} upon completing a long rest. Whenever an infected creature fails a Constitution saving throw, it acquires a point of {@condition exhaustion}.

disease.name: Festering Necrosis
entries: An infected creature gains vulnerability to necrotic damage. Whenever an infected creature would fail one death save, it instead fails two death saves.

disease.name: Leprosy
entries: A creature infected with leprosy devolops disfiguring sores and lesions across its body, giving it disadvantage on Charisma checks. At the end of each week of infection, an afflicted creature makes a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, ending the disease on a success or reducing its maximum hit points by {@dice 2d10} on a failure. A creature that has its maximum hit points reduced by 16 or more at once in this way loses the use of a limb.

disease.name: Wastegash
entries: Whenever an infected creature takes damage, it gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}. When an infected creature dies, each creature within 30 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be infected. This disease persists through death and resurrection, and can be cured only through a Greater Restoration or similar magic.

disease.name: Russet Mold Contagion
entries: An infected creature has vulnerability to Acid and Radiant damage. Upon completing a long rest, the creature's AC is reduced by 2; to a minimum of 10 if the creature is not wearing heavy armor, or to 14 if it is.
